content: jack thermal by sharon bird i wrote this pattern for jack who loves hand knit socks and like a lot of men he likes darker colours and fairly plain socks so i came up with a little 3x3x3 for him three knits three purls and three row in between it creates a look that resembles thermal shirts the picture shows a second pair i made not so dark it also let me try out a smaller size so this version of the pattern has three sizes this is a top down heel flap and gusset sock in a simple waffle pattern it is a great project for a beginner because it uses a lot of standard techniques but is fast to knit the waffle acts as ribbing which will accommodate a large range of foot sizes sizes s m l finished foot circumference 7 5 8 25 9 gauge 8 stitches and 10 row = 1 inch yarn any fingering sock yarn i used fortissima socka in gun metal grey for jack s and lana grossa meilenweit for dh needles 2 25mm or the needle size you need to get gauge i used 2 circular needles but you can use whichever method you prefer 4 or 5 dpn s or magic loop thermal pattern round 1 k3 p3 round 2 3 4 knit cuff cast on 60 66 72 stitches divide evenly over 2 circular needles there will be 30 33 36 instep stitches on needle one and 30 33 36 heel stitches on needle 2 work k3 p3 rib for 15 rounds or 1 5 inches begin pattern and knit until sock measures 8 inches i knit 19 pattern repeats end on round 1 heel setup round for sizes small and large you need to center the pattern on the instep to center the pattern on the instep size s and l only re-arrange the stitches as follows knit across instep needle move 2 stitches from the heel needle to the instep needle and knit them now move the first stitch from the instep needle to the heel needle instep pattern will now start and end with 2 knit stitches and should have 31 37 stitches round 2 has been completed on the instep stitches the heel needle will have 29 35 stitches for size medium the instep is already centered knit across the instep needle which completes round 2 on the instep both the instep and heel needles will have 33 stitches heel flap slip_stitch heel flap is worked over 29 33 35 stitches round 1 s1 k1 to the last two stitches which are knit the heel flap ends with k2 round 2 s1 purl all stitches repeat these two row 15 16 17 times and then repeat round 1 once more heel turn by starting the heel turn with a purl row you eliminate the need to knit back at the end of the heel turn and are ready to pick the gusset stitches s1 p15
